comment.text: This translation key is used to represent the name of an anonymous user or creator. It appears as a placeholder or default text in various UI elements, such as info panels, history blocks, and author cells, when the actual display name cannot be retrieved or is unknown.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ບໍ່ຮູ້ຊື່' literally translates to 'do not know name'. While it conveys the general idea of 'Anonymous', it's a bit verbose and lacks the directness of the English word. A more accurate and natural translation would be something like 'ບໍ່ມີຊື່' (no name).

The Polish translation "Anonimowo" is an adverb, not a noun (which "Anonymous" is). It describes *how* something is done anonymously, rather than referring to the anonymous entity itself. A more appropriate noun translation would be "Anonim".
The translation 'නිර්නාමික' while close, isn't the most natural or common way to translate 'Anonymous' in Sinhala. It's a bit formal and less frequently used.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'අනන්‍යonymous' (anonymus) which is a transliteration and becoming more common, or 'නາມless' which more closely conveys the meaning of 'without a name'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian (Cyrillic) translation "Анонимно" is an adverbial form of "anonymous." The correct noun form, representing the English "Anonymous" as a name or identifier, would be "Анонимус".

The English word 'Anonymous' refers to a person or group who desires to not be identified. The Ukrainian translation 'Анонімно' is an adverb meaning 'anonymously.' This doesn't quite capture the meaning of the English word.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Анонім' (Anonim) which is a noun that translates to 'Anonymous' in the sense of a person or group.
